DOC.brief_summary: This clinical trial will evaluate if Deep Brain Stimulation (DBS) is safe for the treatment of stroke and will help understand if DBS improves motor recovery for patients who continue to have significant impairment.
DOC.brief_title: Electrical Stimulation of the Dentate Nucleus for Upper Extremity Hemiparesis Due to Ischemic Stroke
DOC.detailed_description: The proposed study is a safety and feasibility study intended to provide preliminary data to design a future pilot study. The objective of this study is to document the safety and patient outcomes of electrical stimulation of the dentate nucleus area for the management of chronic, moderate to severe upper extremity hemiparesis due to ischemic stroke.
DOC.criteria: Key One stroke that occurred 12 years ago (i.e. index stroke 1224 months) Stroke due to a blocked blood vessel (i.e. unilateral MCA stroke) Severe weakness in one arm (i.e. unilateral upperextremity hemiparesis) Key Seizures since time of stroke (i.e. seizures or seizure disorder) Unable to have an MRI (i.e. contraindicated for MRI)
